page.title: 16Religion(Survey)
page.content: We asked our sample whether or not they believed in God; 6 declined to answer, 22 replied yes and 8 replied no. When asked what their religion was, 56% said that they were {Church of {England,}6% were{Methodist,}8% were{ {Catholic} and 5% followed other religions. 25% had no religion. When questioned about how often they attended church the results were:- {Once a week 6 { Once a month 2 {Once a year 2 { Rarely 14 {Never 12} This lack of attendance clearly shows evidence of the declining importance of religion in modern society.
